name: That Rotten Wario! Quiz | Video Games | 10 Questions

questions.text: Whom did Wario fight in "Wario Land"?
questions.explanation:
Captain Syrup.

	Captain Syrup returned to menace Wario in "Wario Land II". Both "Wario Land" games were released for the GameBoy.

questions.text: Which of the following choices does Wario love the most?
questions.explanation:
Money.

	Wario is motivated by his love of and desire for money. Wario has dedicated himself to the pursuit of gold coins, which can be found scattered throughout various levels.

questions.text: Which car does Wario commonly use?
questions.explanation:
Wariomobile.

	Wario uses the Wariomobile, as seen in "Wario Land IV" for the GameBoy Advance. In the game, Wario tries to get four pieces of jewelry and faces the Golden Diva.

questions.text: What form is NOT featured in "Wario: Master of Disguise" for the Nintendo DS?
questions.explanation:
Rich Wario.

	Arty Wario, Wicked Wario and Thief Wario are just some of the forms Wario can assume by the player drawing an object on Wario. For example, the player must draw wings on Wario in order to get Wicked Wario.

questions.text: Which device did Wario invent in "Wario: Master of Disguise"?
questions.explanation:
The Telmet.

	The Telmet is a helmet that allowed Wario to enter a television show. He wanted to steal from a thief known as the Silver Zephyr, famous for his disguises.

questions.text: What device does Baby Wario wield in "Yoshi's Island DS"?
questions.explanation:
A magnet.

	Wario's magnet can attract metal boxes and, of course, gold coins. It seems that even though Wario was reduced in age to a baby, it had no effect on his greed!

questions.text: In "WarioWare: Twisted!", where was Wario's GameBoy Advance put?
questions.explanation:
In Crygor's machine.

	After going through the machine, the GameBoy gained a tilt function. In "WarioWare: Twisted!", the player has to rotate the device to win the games.

questions.text: Wario uses his mighty flatulence in "Super Smash Bros.: Brawl".
questions.explanation:
True.

	This attack is called the "Wario Waft". Mario is also a playable character in this long-running series that features predominantly-Nintendo characters fighting against each other.

questions.text: In "Mario Party 6", who is Wario secretly friends with?
questions.explanation:
Toadette.

	Imagine what would happen to Wario's reputation as a lazy glutton if word got out that he was friends with the sweet Toadette!

questions.text: Who fixes Wario's teeth in "WarioWare: Touched!"?
questions.explanation:
Doctor Payne.

	Wario eats too much chocolate, and soon develops a toothache! This requires a trip to see Doctor Payne, which is an unfortunate name for a doctor.
